attributes.action: ban the sale of fireworks to the public and ban bonfires that are not organised
attributes.additional_details: in my hometown of wigan there are gangs of youngsters roaming the streets at night setting of firewores and were only in the first week of october, there making life for most people a misery, there walking the streets without facemasks and if we have to go back to lockdowns who are these same youngsters going to blame only old people.
attributes.background: please ban the sale of fireworks and bonfires that are not organised

departments.name: Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government

rejection.details:
We already have a petition calling for the sale of fireworks to be limited to organisers of licensed displays only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

We also have a number of petitions calling for bonfires to be banned in certain circumstances:

Ban bonfires between May 1st - October 1st: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323500

Ban all bonfires in built up areas: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330421

Ban bonfires during daylight hours: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324851

If you want all bonfires that have not been professionally organised to be banned, you could start a new petition calling for bonfires to be banned unless they have been given permission by the relevant local authority.
